name: Camille
title: the Steel Shadow
q_displayname: Precision Protocol / Precision Protocol 2 / Precision Protocol 3

i1.blurb: Basic attacks on champions grant a shield equal to 20% of Camille's maximum health against their damage type (Physical or Magic) for 1.5-2.5 seconds. This effect has a 20-10 second cooldown.
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Camille's''' next [[basic attack]] against enemy [[champions]] is periodically enhanced to {{sti|shield}} her for {{as|20% of her '''maximum''' health}} for 2 seconds from either exclusively {{tip|physical damage|{{as|physical damage}}}} or {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}}, based on which type would mitigate the most damage from her target.
i1.name: Adaptive Defenses
notes: * The shield-typing is determined based on the total damage the target has dealt to champions that game (as a percentage) versus Camille's current armor and magic resistance.

** For example, with little bonus resistances Camille would likely gain the most obvious shield-typing - i.e. physical versus marksmen and magical versus mages. However, with a full-armor build - she may gain a magic damage shield versus a target like {{ci|Kog'Maw}}, as his physical threat is already mitigated by the armor.
* What shield she will gain is displayed as an icon beneath an enemy's health bar: Orange for Physical or Blue for Magical.

q1.blurb: Camille's next attack deals bonus damage and grants bonus movement speed. This spell can be recast for a short period of time, doing significantly increased bonus damage if Camille delays a period of time between the two attacks.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Camille's''' next basic attack has {{sti|range|50 '''bonus''' range}}, deals {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} and grants {{as|{{sti|movement speed|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} for 1 second.
''Precision Protocol'' can then be {{ai|Precision Protocol 2|Camille|recast}} within the next {{fd|3.5}} seconds at no extra cost.

If recast at least {{fd|1.5}} seconds after the first attack, ''Precision Protocol's'' [[damage]] is doubled and {{pp|16|key=%|40 to 100|formula=36%+(4%*level). ''Capped at level 16''}} of the total damage is dealt as {{as|{{sti|true damage}}}}.
Both casts of ''Precision Protocol'' reset '''Camille's''' autoattack timer.
leveling: {{st|Bonus Physical Damage|{{as|{{ap|20 to 40}}% AD}}}}{{st|Bonus Movement Speed|{{ap|20 to 40}}%}}
q1.name: Precision Protocol
notes: * ''Precision Protocol'' gains additional 50 autoattack range on both casts.

w1.blurb: Camille blasts in a cone after a delay, dealing damage. Enemies in the outer half are slowed and take extra damage, while also healing Camille.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} After a brief delay, '''Camille''' sweeps her leg to deal {{as|physical damage}} to all enemies in a cone in front of her.

Enemies hit by the outer half of the cone take {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} and are {{tip|slow|slowed}} by 80% that decays over 2 seconds, capped at 300 damage against monsters. '''Camille''' is {{tip|healing|healed}} for the ''bonus damage'' dealt against enemy champions.
leveling: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|70 to 190}} {{as|(+ 60% '''bonus''' AD)}}|Non-Epic Monster Damage|{{ap|70/2 to 190/2}} {{as|(+ 30% '''bonus''' AD)}}}}

{{st|Outer Cone Bonus Damage|{{as|{{ap|6 to 8}}% {{as|(+ {{fd|3.{{recurring|3}}}}% per 100 '''bonus''' AD)}} of target's '''maximum''' health}}|Bonus Non-Epic Monster Damage|{{as|{{ap|6/2 to 8/2}}% {{as|(+ {{fd|1.{{recurring|6}}}}% per 100 '''bonus''' AD)}} of target's '''maximum''' health}}}}
w1.name: Tactical Sweep
notes: * Camille can move during the delay, but the damage and Camille's model are fixed to the initial target direction.
** Camille's facing-direction, for effects such as {{ai|Petrifying Gaze|Cassiopeia}}, is the direction she is moving, and not the direction her model is facing.
* The 50% damage reduction against non-epic monsters applies after the cap. Because of this the actual cap against non-epic monsters is 150 damage.

e1.blurb: Camille pulls herself to a wall, leaping off and knocking up enemies upon landing.
description: {{sbc|First Cast - Hookshot:}} '''Camille''' fires a grapple in the target direction. If the grapple collides with terrain, '''Camille''' will {{tip|dash}} toward and bind to the terrain for {{fd|0.75}} seconds. While bound to the terrain, she gains the ability to cast {{ai|Wall Dive|Camille}}.

{{sbc|Second Cast - Wall dive:}} '''Camille''' {{tip|dashes}} in the target direction, stopping at the first enemy hit. If the enemy hit is a champion, they are also {{tip|stun|stunned}} for {{fd|0.75}} seconds. At maximum range or enemy collision, '''Camille''' deals {{as|physical damage}} to nearby enemies.
The range is doubled towards enemy champions. If she collides with an enemy champion, she is also granted {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' attack speed}}}} for 5 seconds.
e1.name: Hookshot
notes: * Despite what one might assume from a wall-jumping ability, ''Wall Dive'' '''can''' be used to go through terrain (including the terrain she is bound to).

r1.blurb: Camille dashes to target champion, anchoring them to the area. She also deals bonus magic damage to the target with her basic attacks.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Camille''' becomes {{tip|untargetable}} and leaps toward the target enemy champion.
When she lands, she creates a locked, hexagonal zone around the target for a duration, {{tip|interrupt|interrupting}} them and {{tip|airborne|knocking away}} all other nearby enemies on impact.
The target can move freely inside the zone, but cannot escape it through any means. While within the zone, '''Camille's''' basic attacks deal {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}.
''The Hextech Ultimatum'' ends automatically within 1 second if '''Camille''' leaves the area or dies.
r1.name: The Hextech Ultimatum
notes: * The ability will be cancelled and go on cooldown if the target dies or becomes ''untargetable'' during the cast time.
* Parry effects will mitigate only the on-hit magic damage, and does not interact with the perimeter.
* The perimeter applies {{tip|knockdown}} each time the target attempts to leave.

* The edge of the perimeter is considered to be terrain for [[dash]] and charge effects, such as {{ai|Quickdraw|Graves}} and {{ai|Unstoppable Onslaught|Sion}}, and will cause the champion to be displaced back into the area.
** Ground-targeted abilities that cause the champion to walk in range will declare an invalid target.
** Ground-targeted abilities that go off at maximum range regardless of the target location will go off toward the edge of the arena.

* An active {{ai|Assault and Battery|Vi}} on a target outside the perimeter will cause {{ci|Vi}} to continue her charge until she is able to reach her target. Interestingly, she can knockback and damage secondary targets multiple times.
* {{cai|Devour|Tahm Kench}} can carry ''Camille's'' target outside of the area, but they will be displaced back inside once {{ai|Regurgitate|Tahm Kench|Regurgitated}}.
* {{ais|Chronobreak|Ekko}} damage will go off at the hologram's location, but Ekko will materialise inside the area.
